findings.title: Kong Admin API Exposed Without Authentication
findings.description: Kong Admin API is accessible from the internet without authentication on port 8001. This allows unauthorized users to modify gateway configuration, add routes, and access sensitive data.
findings.remediation: Enable authentication on Admin API using key-auth or RBAC plugin, or restrict access to internal network only

findings.title: Internal API Route Exposed to Partners
findings.description: Kong route '/internal/admin' is configured to forward requests to internal admin API but is accessible from partner network. This route should only be accessible from internal network.
findings.remediation: Add IP restriction plugin to limit access to internal network ranges only

findings.title: Rate Limiting Not Configured
findings.description: Partner API routes do not have rate limiting configured, allowing potential abuse and denial of service attacks.
findings.remediation: Configure rate-limiting plugin with appropriate limits (e.g., 1000 requests per hour per consumer)

findings.title: Missing Request Size Limit
findings.description: Webhook endpoint does not have request size limit configured, allowing potential memory exhaustion attacks.
findings.remediation: Configure request-size-limiting plugin with maximum payload size (e.g., 10MB)
